lisflood:
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Lislood modelling and reporting options #
# all the model's options all listed here # 0 in default = this option is by default not used # 1 in default = this is used by default # if an option is used can be specified in the settingsfile # #----------------------------------------------------------- # modelling and reporting options #----------------------------------------------------------- # option to turn hydrological modules on/off
# option to compute indicators
#option to turn MonteCarlo and EnKF on/off
# option to initialize Lisflood
# option to read/write NetCDF
#----------------------------------------------------------- # report time series #----------------------------------------------------------- # report discharge
# report number of soil, routing wateruse steps
# report water balance errors
# report gauges and sites
#----------------------------------------------------------- # report state/end maps #----------------------------------------------------------- # report state maps
# repor end maps
# report input/output meteo maps
# report maps
#Reported actual evapotranspiration [mm] #Surface runoff + UZ [mm]
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # report Times Series # all possible output as time series are listed here # name: name of this variable in the settings.xml # outputVar: name of the output variable in the code # where: where is the time series reported: e.g. gauges, sites, 1, Catchments, LakeSites etc. # repoption: time serie is reported if one of these option is active # restrictoption: time serie is only reported if this option(s) are active # operation: operation to be done before reporting e.g. mapmaximum, total (=catchmenttotal) #
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # GAUGES # report at gauges - repDischargeTs and/or repWaterLevelTs # Report discharge and water level at output points # Each variable is average on time step reporting in [mm/time step]
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Internal number of sub step for soil, channel routing, water use
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # SITES # report at Sites - repStateSites # Intermediate state variables at sites
# report at Sites - repRateSites # Intermediate rate variables at sites (all as pixel-average rates in [mm/time step]) # Note on variables ending with "Pixel" suffix: these are all variables that are internally # calculated for permeable fraction of each pixel only. The "Pixel" values are spatial averages, # averaged over whole pixel (to keep them consistent with all other reported rate variables)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # GAUGES # Catchment-averaged values of input meteo variables - repStateUpsGauges # Each variable is accumulated over contributing area, and then # divided by number of pixels to get average over contributing area # Driving meteo variables # reporting in [mm/time step], no intensities!
# Catchment-averaged values of model state variables # Each variable is accumulated over contributing area, and then # divided by number of pixels to get average over contributing area
# repRateUpsGauges # Catchment-averaged values of model rate variables # Each variable is accumulated over contributing area, and then # divided by number of pixels to get average over contributing area # all in [mm/time step] # Note on variables ending with "Pixel" suffix: these are all variables that are internally # calculated for permeable fraction of each pixel only. The "Pixel" values are spatial averages, # averaged over whole pixel (to keep them consistent with all other reported rate variables)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Report time series of lakes, reservoirs, polders, wateruse # repsimulateLakes (only for option simulateLakes)
# repsimulateReservoirs (only for option simulateReservoirs)
# repsimulatePolders (only for option simulatePolders)
# repwateruse ((only for option wateruse)
# repwateruseSites ((only for option wateruse)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # report PF # repPFSites, repPFUpsGauges
# report LZAvInflow # repLZAvInflowSites, repLZAvInflowUpsGauges
# In
# Out
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Report Maps # all possible output as maps listed here # name: name of this variable in the settings.xml # outputVar: name of the output variable in the code # unit: what unit has this variable e.g. m, mm, degree !!! has to checked!! # end: reported only at last step # steps: reported at report steps # all: reported on all steps # restrictoption: map is only reported if this option(s) are active
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Maps of intermediate state variables at selected time steps # Time steps in ReportSteps defined in 'timer section!' # Typically used as initial conditions for succeeding simulation! # no forest [0] forest [1] # # Reporting of "state" maps
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Reporting of "end" maps
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Input maps # Note differences between in- and output: # PrecipitationMaps: input [mm/day]; may cover whole map area # PrecipitationMapsOut: output [mm/time step], covers mask area only!
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Optional reporting of *individual* model state variables as maps
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Optional reporting of model rate variables as maps # all rates in [mm/time step]
# Runoff maps
# These options report pF and vegetation stress due to low soil moisture
# Earth2Observe maps
# storage lakes river channel floodplains missing # soil moisture missing
# Water Abstraction
# Water Use
# Water Consumption Indicators
